body:
This code did change, yes

Can you post the result of `rclone about remote:` with 1.52.1 and v1.51.0 please?

Thanks

:~# rclone version
rclone v1.52.1
- os/arch: linux/386
- go version: go1.14.4

:~# rclone about T-Online:
Total:   0
Used:    0
Free:    0

:~# rclone about 4shared:
Total:   0
Used:    0
Free:    0

Ina  few minutes I uninstall rclone version 1.52.1 and check the output of the requested command with rclone version 1.51.0 .

:~# rclone version
rclone v1.51.0
- os/arch: linux/386
- go version: go1.13.7

:~# rclone about T-Online:
NO OUTPUT, GIVES BACK THE PROMPT - strange

:~# rclone about Box:
2020/06/14 11:04:24 Failed to about: box root '' doesn't support about

Indeed, with df -h -T I get:
:~# df -h -T /srv/backup/t-online.de /srv/backup/box.com
Filesystem     Type         Size  Used Avail Use% Mounted on
T-Online:      fuse.rclone  1.0P     0  1.0P   0% /srv/backup/t-online.de
Box:           fuse.rclone  1.0P     0  1.0P   0% /srv/backup/box.com

Sorry, I have missed this:
:~# rclone about 4shared:
NO OUTPUT, GIVES BACK THE PROMPT - strange again.

Can you do this with rclone 1.52.1 and post the result please?

    rclone about T-Online: -vv --dump bodies

That will show exactly what T-Online is returning to make rclone think it has 0 Total, Free and Used!

I have run it, here is the debug info:

```
:~# rclone about T-Online: -vv --dump bodies
2020/06/14 12:23:59 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.52.1" starting with parameters ["rclone" "about" "T-Online:" "-vv" "--dump" "bodies"]
2020/06/14 12:23:59 DEBUG : Using config file from "/root/.config/rclone/rclone.conf"
2020/06/14 12:23:59 DEBUG : You have specified to dump information. Please be noted that the Accept-Encoding as shown may not be correct in the request and the response may not show Content-Encoding if the go standard libraries auto gzip encoding was in effect. In this case the body of the request will be gunzipped before showing it.
2020/06/14 12:23:59 DEBUG : >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
2020/06/14 12:23:59 DEBUG : HTTP REQUEST (req 0xc498380)
2020/06/14 12:23:59 DEBUG : PROPFIND / HTTP/1.1
Host: webdav.magentacloud.de
User-Agent: rclone/v1.52.1
Content-Length: 139
Authorization: XXXX
Depth: 0
Referer: https://webdav.magentacloud.de/
Accept-Encoding: gzip

<?xml version="1.0" ?>
<D:propfind xmlns:D="DAV:">
 <D:prop>
  <D:quota-available-bytes/>
  <D:quota-used-bytes/>
 </D:prop>
</D:propfind>
2020/06/14 12:23:59 DEBUG : >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
2020/06/14 12:23:59 DEBUG : <<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<
2020/06/14 12:23:59 DEBUG : HTTP RESPONSE (req 0xc498380)
2020/06/14 12:23:59 DEBUG : HTTP/1.1 207 Multi-Status
Content-Length: 307
Content-Type: text/xml; charset="utf-8"
Date: Sun, 14 Jun 2020 10:23:59 GMT
Ms-Author-Via: DAV
Server: Apache
Strict-Transport-Security: max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<D:multistatus xmlns:D="DAV:" xmlns:ns0="DAV:">
<D:response xmlns:g0="DAV:">
<D:href>/</D:href>
<D:propstat>
<D:prop>
<g0:quota-available-bytes/>
<g0:quota-used-bytes/>
</D:prop>
<D:status>HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found</D:status>
</D:propstat>
</D:response>
</D:multistatus>
2020/06/14 12:23:59 DEBUG : <<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<
Total:   0
Used:    0
Free:    0
2020/06/14 12:23:59 DEBUG : 4 go routines active
```

Ah, it looks like we asked for the quota and it wasn't available so we treated it as 0 rather than unavailable...

The provider returned this which made rclone think the property was there

```xml
<g0:quota-available-bytes/>
<g0:quota-used-bytes/>
```

Can you try this fix to see if it works?

It should revert to printing nothing on `rclone about` hopefully!

https://beta.rclone.org/branch/v1.52.1-067-g6ccbf354-fix-4348-webdav-about-beta/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)
I have seen there packages for many operating systems, but a linux version is unfortunately missing. Could you compile one for linux 386?

I had no other chance to test it except the Windows version (rclone-v1.52.1-067-g6ccbf354-fix-4348-webdav-about-beta-windows-amd64.zip). After getting and installing WinFSP I managed to mount my drive at T-Online:
>rclone mount T-Online: T:
The service rclone has been started.

In Windows Explorer I have seen all data copied formerly on Debian to the cloud storage. I have started another command prompt window to check the about command:
>rclone about T-Online:
Total:   0
Used:    0
Free:    0

>rclone version
rclone v1.52.1-067-g6ccbf354-fix-4348-webdav-about-beta
- os/arch: windows/amd64
- go version: go1.14.4
So this is bad news, the patch does not seem to work, unfortunately. Can you check the code again, please?

Thanks for testing and sorry about having to use the Windows build. The CI failed to make all the builds.

Here is a second attempt - I think this should work :crossed_fingers: 

https://beta.rclone.org/branch/v1.52.1-073-g20a3530c-fix-4348-webdav-about-beta/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

Hello! I have successfully finished with testing of rclone-v1.52.1-073-g20a3530c-fix-4348-webdav-about-beta-linux-386.deb . Everything works as expected. By my two webdav storages, T-Online and 4shared the rclone about command now gives back the prompt as by former versions. The output of the "df -hT" command for total and available spaces gives back 1P (1 petabyte) as before. All my 6 mounted cloud storages look like before. Thank you and the rclone team the support and the great program!

Thanks for testing :-)

I've merged this to master now which means it will be in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org) in 15-30 mins and released in v1.52.2

issue.title: WebDav Nextcloud remote reporting quota-available-bytes and quota-used-bytes as 0

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
#### The associated forum post URL from `https://forum.rclone.org`
Associated with a merged solution for a bug [https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/4348](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/4348) which is similar to this.


#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?
Rclone reports 0 used and 0 available space from WebDav Nextcloud. Even if I use the flag `--vfs-disk-space-total-size 1T` the total space then is 1T (tested on Windows 11), but available space is still 0. GUI programs fail to write to it as they check for available space, while CLI file commands like `cp` and `mv` work fine.


#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)

```
[REDACTED ~]$ rclone version
rclone v1.62.2
- os/version: arch "rolling" (64 bit)
- os/kernel: 6.3.8-arch1-1 (x86_64)
- os/type: linux
- os/arch: amd64
- go/version: go1.20.4
- go/linking: dynamic
- go/tags: none
```

#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (e.g. Windows 7, 64 bit)

Arch Linux and Windows 11. Happens on both.


#### Which cloud storage system are you using?

WebDav Nextcloud. I host one myself, the other is a [Hetzner Storage Share](https://www.hetzner.com/storage/storage-share).


#### The command you were trying to run?

Just:

```
rclone mount nextcloud-personal:
```

I use it as a systemd mount (as instructed in Rclone documentation):

```
[Unit]
After=network-online.target
[Mount]
Type=rclone
What=nextcloud-personal:
Where=/mnt/nextcloud_personal
Options=rw,allow_other,args2env,vfs-cache-mode=full,config=/etc/rclone.conf,cache-dir=/var/rclone
```

#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (e.g. output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
```
[REDACTED ~]$ rclone about nextcloud-personal:  -vv --dump bodies
<7>DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.62.2" starting with parameters ["rclone" "about" "nextcloud-personal:" "-vv" "--dump" "bodies"]
<7>DEBUG : rclone: systemd logging support activated
<7>DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "nextcloud-personal:"
<7>DEBUG : Using config file from "/home/REDACTED/.config/rclone/rclone.conf"
<7>DEBUG : found headers: 
<7>DEBUG : You have specified to dump information. Please be noted that the Accept-Encoding as shown may not be correct in the request and the response may not show Content-Encoding if the go standard libraries auto gzip encoding was in effect. In this case the body of the request will be gunzipped before showing it.
<7>DEBUG : >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
<7>DEBUG : HTTP REQUEST (req 0xc000a78400)
<7>DEBUG : PROPFIND /remote.php/dav/files/REDACTED/ HTTP/1.1
Host: REDACTED
User-Agent: rclone/v1.62.2
Content-Length: 139
Authorization: XXXX
Depth: 0
Referer: https://REDACTED/remote.php/dav/files/REDACTED/
Accept-Encoding: gzip

<?xml version="1.0" ?>
<D:propfind xmlns:D="DAV:">
 <D:prop>
  <D:quota-available-bytes/>
  <D:quota-used-bytes/>
 </D:prop>
</D:propfind>
<7>DEBUG : >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
<7>DEBUG : <<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<
<7>DEBUG : HTTP RESPONSE (req 0xc000a78400)
<7>DEBUG : HTTP/2.0 207 Multi-Status
Cache-Control: no-store, no-cache, must-revalidate
Content-Security-Policy: default-src 'none';
Content-Type: application/xml; charset=utf-8
Date: Wed, 21 Jun 2023 17:39:57 GMT
Dav: 1, 3, extended-mkcol, access-control, calendarserver-principal-property-search, nextcloud-checksum-update, nc-calendar-search, nc-enable-birthday-calendar, 2
Expires: Thu, 19 Nov 1981 08:52:00 GMT
Pragma: no-cache
Referrer-Policy: no-referrer
Server: Apache/2.4.54 (Debian)
SameSite=strict
Strict-Transport-Security: 15552000
Vary: Brief,Prefer
X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
X-Debug-Token: ED3B77mHnoUCxoNcnnAs
X-Frame-Options: SAMEORIGIN
X-Permitted-Cross-Domain-Policies: none
X-Powered-By: PHP/8.1.12
X-Request-Id: ED3B77mHnoUCxoNcnnAs
X-Robots-Tag: none
X-Xss-Protection: 1; mode=block

<?xml version="1.0"?>
<d:multistatus xmlns:d="DAV:" xmlns:s="http://sabredav.org/ns" xmlns:oc="http://owncloud.org/ns" xmlns:nc="http://nextcloud.org/ns"><d:response><d:href>/remote.php/dav/files/REDACTED/</d:href><d:propstat><d:prop><d:quota-available-bytes>0</d:quota-available-bytes><d:quota-used-bytes>0</d:quota-used-bytes></d:prop><d:status>HTTP/1.1 200 OK</d:status></d:propstat></d:response></d:multistatus>
<7>DEBUG : <<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<
Total:   0 B
Used:    0 B
Free:    0 B
<7>DEBUG : 3 go routines active
```

Running `df` also returns the same:

```
[REDACTED ~]$ df -h -T /mnt/nextcloud_personal
Filesystem          Type         Size  Used Avail Use% Mounted on
nextcloud-personal: fuse.rclone     0     0     0    - /mnt/nextcloud_personal
```

<!--- Please keep the note below for others who read your bug report. -->

#### How to use GitHub

* Please use the  [reaction](https://blog.github.com/2016-03-10-add-reactions-to-pull-requests-issues-and-comments/) to show that you are affected by the same issue.
* Please don't comment if you have no relevant information to add. It's just extra noise for everyone subscribed to this issue.
* Subscribe to receive notifications on status change and new comments.
